docs.title: Grey Hack Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Grey Hack Documentation! This guide is designed to help both new and experienced players navigate the game, learn hacking techniques, and understand in-game mechanics.

docs.title: What is Grey Hack?
docs.text: Grey Hack is a massively multiplayer hacking simulation game where players explore a virtual network, execute commands, and develop their skills in cybersecurity and ethical hacking.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
If you're new to Grey Hack, start here:

  • Getting Started – Setting up your environment and understanding the basics.
  • Hacking Basics – Learn fundamental hacking techniques and commands.
  • Networking – Understand how the in-game network functions.

docs.title: Reference
docs.text:
For detailed information on commands and exploits, refer to:

  • Commands – A list of available in-game commands and their uses.
  • Exploits – Common vulnerabilities and exploits within Grey Hack.

docs.title: Troubleshooting and FAQs
docs.text:
Having issues? Check these sections:

  • FAQ – Frequently asked questions and answers.
  • Troubleshooting – Common problems and solutions.

docs.title: Community & Resources
docs.text:
Explore these resources for more help and discussions:

  • Steam Community Guides
  • Grey Hack Reddit
  • YouTube Tutorials
  • GitHub Projects

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
This documentation is a work in progress. If you have suggestions or would like to contribute, check out the GitHub repository and feel free to submit pull requests!

Happy hacking, and enjoy Grey Hack!

docs.title: Getting Started with Grey Hack
docs.text: Welcome to Grey Hack! This guide will help you set up the game, understand the basics, and get started on your hacking journey.

docs.title: Installing the Game
docs.text:
Grey Hack is available on Steam. Follow these steps to install it:

  1. Open Steam and search for Grey Hack.
  2. Purchase or download the game if you already own it.
  3. Install the game and launch it from your Steam Library.

docs.title: Creating Your Character
docs.text:
When you first start Grey Hack, you'll be prompted to create a character. This involves:

  • Choosing a username.
  • Selecting a difficulty level (if applicable).

docs.title: Understanding the Interface
docs.text:
Grey Hack is a terminal-based game with a simulated operating system. Here are the main components:

  • Desktop – The main interface where you interact with files, applications, and terminals.
  • Terminal – The core tool for executing commands and hacking.
  • File Explorer – Used to navigate and manage files on your system.
  • Network Scanner – Helps discover available hosts and services.

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text:
Here are some essential terminal commands to get started:

  • ls – Lists files in the current directory.
  • cd <directory> – Changes the current directory.
  • cat <filename> – Displays the contents of a file.
  • nano <filename> – Opens a text file for editing.
  • ifconfig – Displays network information.

docs.title: First Steps
docs.text:
1. Open the terminal and explore your system using the above commands.
  2. Navigate through directories to familiarize yourself with the file structure.
  3. Use help to see available commands.
  4. Try scanning the network with nmap <IP> (you'll learn more about this later!).

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Once you're comfortable with the basics, check out these guides: - Hacking Basics – Learn fundamental hacking techniques. - Networking – Understanding in-game networking concepts.

With this foundation, you're ready to dive deeper into Grey Hack and begin your hacking adventure!

Continue learning and experimenting – hacking is all about curiosity and problem-solving!

docs.title: Hacking Basics in Grey Hack
docs.text: This guide introduces the fundamental concepts of hacking in Grey Hack, covering reconnaissance, gaining access, and maintaining persistence.

docs.title: Understanding the Hacking Process
docs.text:
Hacking in Grey Hack follows a structured process:

  1. Reconnaissance – Gathering information about targets.
  2. Exploitation – Using vulnerabilities to gain access.
  3. Privilege Escalation – Gaining higher-level permissions.
  4. Persistence – Maintaining access to a compromised system.

docs.title: Reconnaissance
docs.text:
Before hacking, you need to gather information about your target. Common techniques include:

  • Scanning the Network: Use nmap <IP> to identify open ports and services.
  • Checking System Info: Commands like uname -a reveal OS details.
  • Exploring Directories: Look for configuration files or logs with ls -la.

docs.title: Exploiting Vulnerabilities
docs.text:
Once you have gathered information, you can look for weaknesses:

  • Default Credentials: Some systems use weak or default passwords.
  • Exploitable Services: Open ports running outdated services may have known exploits.
  • Brute Force Attacks: Tools like hydra can attempt to crack passwords.

docs.title: Gaining Access
docs.text:
To break into a system, you can:

  • Use known exploits (exploit <target> if available).
  • Try SSH or FTP login with discovered credentials (ssh user@IP).
  • Inject malicious scripts if permissions allow.

docs.title: Privilege Escalation
docs.text:
After gaining initial access, escalate privileges to control the system:

  • Check User Permissions: Use whoami and sudo -l.
  • Search for Misconfigurations: Some files may have improper permissions.
  • Use Kernel Exploits: Outdated kernels might have vulnerabilities.

docs.title: Maintaining Persistence
docs.text:
To keep access after a reboot:

  • Create a Backdoor: Add a new user or set up SSH keys.
  • Modify System Services: Hide processes or modify startup scripts.
  • Cover Your Tracks: Clear logs using rm /var/log/* (but be careful!).

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you understand the basics, explore:

  • Networking – Learn about connections, IP addresses, and firewalls.
  • Exploits – A list of known exploits within Grey Hack.

Practice your skills ethically and experiment within the game!
